name: Hotel de las Letras

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very good, clean, efficient with modern decor hotel. the staff were friendly and efficient and the hotel is in a central location on the Gran Via.
reviews.title: Great modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The only advice to people staying here is to watch the prices in the rooftop terrace bar, a jack daniels and coke cost us 15 euros - a substantial shot of JD but still expensive for spirits - beer and wine is more reasonable.
reviews.title: Trendy & stylish - but not quite

likes.disliked: — It wasn't mentioned on the website that the fitness/spa facilities were closed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I was in Madrid on business and wanted to stay one day longer to explore the city. I mainly chose this hotel based on its location and the fitness & spa facilities, as I wanted to treat myself to some pampering after the working week. When I arrived at the hotel on Friday afternoon, I was told that both the fitness room and the spa were closed. Naturally I was very disappointed and told them that this should have been mentioned on their website. After some complaining and begging they did eventually let me into the gym, but that was also a letdown as it consisted of one treadmill and one exercise bike. I suppose the Spanish idea of a gym is different from the English one. As I couldn't break into a sweat with the malfunctioning equipment, I eventually ended up going for a jog in the nearby Parque del Retiro in +28 C heat. It surely did the job.
reviews.title: Chic Madrid Refuge

likes.liked: — The rooms and the decor, the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a bad start I wasn't particularly impressed with the trendy room that had been furnished with Ikea-like furniture. I found it cheap and lacking in character, but that is just my personal opinion. The biblioteca downstairs looked nice though, but the restaurant I found a bit too dark.
reviews.title: Stylish but inconsistant service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a very good location as it is a walking distance from restaurants and shops. All in all, it wasn't too bad, but next time I will try something else.
reviews.title: Magnificence in Madrid
Perfect
reviews.text: We just come back from a stay in the Hotel Las Letras of Madrid, member of the Design Hotel.Overall opinion is: excellent hotel. The hotel is pretty well located right in the center of Madrid and next to a subway station (200m, it takes 25 min from the airport by subway). We have been pretty lucky to be upgraded to a superior room with a terasse. The rooms are very clean and well decorated in a very contemporary design style. The bed is very large and confortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The documentation that you can find in the room is very usefull and well realised.
reviews.title: Excellent as other reviews state
Average standard, poor service and Beware of Theft scam in Madrid
reviews.text: The morning buffet is excellent and all the personel is very kind.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: One of the best hotel I ever visited in this category. For those who like actual design decoration it is the place where to go in Madrid
reviews.title: Loved De Las Letras

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a deluxe room for four nights with our nine month baby. Although the jacuzzi on the balcony seemed to be a bonus. Everything was prepared for our arrival and there were lots of small touches which were thoughful such as special tolietry packs for the small one .
reviews.title: very good but could be better

likes.disliked: — poor lighting in room and unclear facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: Fantastic location, closest to Plaza del Sol and the Museo del Prado, but no more than a 15 min walk to Plaza Santa Anna and 20 to Plaza Mayor.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Modern decor, the elevator only has a black light. The biblioteca, where you can use their internet-enabled computer for free, is in the basement. The hotel also has a bar (opened at night only) on the 7th floor, overlooking the Gran Via, and you can see a lot of the city from there. The breakfast was not included, but at 14 Euros per person, was not outrageous either.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our Superior room had a personal jacuzzi on the 6th floor. Great bathroom. Very comfy king-sized bed.
reviews.title: Simply the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We also stayed at the Catalonia Las Cortes, which we also loved, but this one was just a tinge better.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastik

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is the third time we have stayed in this hotel, and for the third time it has been a brilliant stay. After spending a week in a villa near Segovia, we had 3 days showing the children Madrid itself. As we have 3 children, we booked a suite with its own terrace and jacuzzi - this didn't cost a lot more than a standard double (about £30 per night). It is well worth the extra, giving the whole family a private place to chill out and cool down in the heat of teh day.
reviews.title: Stylish and contemporary with no attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful location! Right in the middle of historic Old Town. Most everything is a short walk away. Very nicely remodeled interior, very modern. Room & bathroom was very large by European standards. Well insulated from road noise (5th floor overlooking Gran Via). Very clean, comfortable, and nice service-people. Highly recommend!!
reviews.title: Wonderful - location, people, comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as those "design hotels" go, this one is a wonderful one. First of all, very well located, in the central madrid. Then, a very nice building, 19 century, i guess, refurbished. At last the style: modern, in a good way. Everything is beautiful, from the bar and dining room, to the terrace we had with our room. The place has a weakness: the fitness room, very small ( only one machine!) but you can run to the parc retiro, very close. As good a place for week end, then for working.
reviews.title: beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the De Las Letras for a short break. It's a nice hotel, very modern and cool decor, comfortable bed, and very clean. The library is a nice feature. The rooms are not huge, but big enough for a city centre hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well situated, within walking distance of all the main sights of central Madrid (except the Bernabeu stadium, which is easily reached by metro).
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — Large room, comfy bed and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the other side of the Gran Via, the main road on which the hotel is located, there is quite a trendy nightlife area, with some good, and cheap, restaurants.
reviews.title: Cool Hotel

likes.disliked: — Music in the bar too loud and low lighting in the lifts.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: I am hard pressed to add anything new to the reviews of this hotel. I loved it. I will say that the Friday night we were there it was very loud in the corner room. And quiet the other nights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed hear in late October for a weekend away without the kids. I booked it having read the reviews on TripAdvisor and wasn't disappointed. It is very centrally located for everything. 10 mins walk to Plaza de Santa Ana where the nightlife is and an similar distance to the museums. The open-top tourist bus also passes by the door.
reviews.title: Cool hotel for a weekend in Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It is quite hip and trendy and whilst we used to be, we didn't feel out of place as the other guests were quite mixed. Rooms are quite spacious for a big city and the bed was v. comfortable. Take a Spanish translation book to decipher the quotes on the bedroom walls or you will drive yourself mad trying to guess.
reviews.title: Liked it a lot

likes.liked: — Blue light in elevator, free WLan in our room,
likes.disliked: — Hassle of getting coffee for breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar is good with reasonably priced tapas and salads and the roof terrace looked great, althought due to the time of year the bar was not opened when we went up (even thought it was an unseasonable 25 centigrade). Would definitely stay here again and would recommend to anyone else.
reviews.title: Can't really fault it...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice design hotel in a superb location. The subway is just 100m away. Bars and restaurants are right on the doorstep (try the area opposite Gran Via). Check-In and Checkout went smooth, the room was nice with wooden floors, plasmaTV and high ceilings. The bar is pricey, breakfast was nice, but not great. Getting coffee for breakfast was quite an effort... If you like coffee-refills get one of the upper tables near the aisle, not the ones down on the buffet.
reviews.title: Good hotel but why all the hype?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel De Las Letras for 4 nights in early March 2006. Because of the length of our stay, we were upgraded to a fabulous room (520) with a glassed-in balcony overlooking the Gran Via. The room was chic and spacious and the bathroom was also quite large and comfortable.
reviews.title: Fabulous! Excellent Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005
reviews.text: We loved the combination of old architecture and modern decor...the room had a comfy bed with upholstered headboard, white down duvet and pillows as well as a cute little couch and ottoman, and desk/chair in a sitting area. The couch was on wheels, so we could turn it to face out to the balcony whenever we ordered room service.
reviews.title: couldn't be better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: There was a "library" in the basement with computers so it was easy to stay in touch with our friends/colleagues at home during our stay. The hotel bar/restaurant made some delicious drinks.
reviews.title: Trendy but dark!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location. The rooms are very clean. The bathroom were clean & modern,
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The negatives: Bathrooms had little privacy - with only a loose sliding door. Agree with a previous posting - very poorly lit .
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, great location, BAD service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Concierge - poor for recommendations... sent us down to a very dodgy area one night in search of a restaraunt. Another night sent us to another very poor restaraunt.
reviews.title: Great hotel but give the restaurant a miss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all would stay again for location alone.
reviews.title: Liked it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful design hotel in a great part of town. Ideal location with shopping and great restaurants near by.
reviews.title: Design boutique hotel

likes.disliked: — No hot water for a day!

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: We had a long weekend at De Las Letras and were thoroughly impressed. Our room was large, clean and with everything you could need - including a terrific roof terrace with jacuzzi. Try and get a room on the 6th floor if possible. Above all it was quiet - don't be put off by the central location - once we shut the windows there was no noise. Staff were friendly and unfussy (check in and out took 2 minutes). We didn't use the spa facilites. Agree with some previous comments about the bar - staff were too slow and unhelpful, but there are loads of other places to have a drink nearby (it's very close to the trendy Chueca district). Another tip - have breakfast in your room. It costs the same, you get more and the hotel breakfast room is quite small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel de las Letras last January and were very pleased. A frequent traveler, I am also very picky when it comes to hotels. Our room was spacious, bright and clean and even had an outdoor hot tub on our very own private balcony. Unfortunately, the door to the balcony was stuck and we didn't bother asking for someone fix it so we didn't take full advantage of all the room had to offer...The bar was relaxed, but buzzing all day- a nice place to meet people or have a quick drink before heading out. Locationwise, the hotel is very central. Will definitely be staying there again...Do beware...the beds are on wheels.
reviews.title: Simply Trendy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel De las Letras lived up to its billing, nd more. We had two, 3-day stays bookending a week in Costa del Sol, and loved the hotel. The location is perfect for tourists, right in the heart of Bourbon Madrid, an easy walk to major attractions like Museo Prado, Palacio Real and Plaza Mayor.
reviews.title: Lived up to the hype

likes.disliked: — Room lighting could be improved a bit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were large, airy and well furnished, with an incredibly comfortable bed and pillows. The bathroom was modern and spacious, lacking a bidet but making up for it with a large tub/shower. Plenty of storage space was provided, though there are no dressers or drawers - everything goes into the large closets. The staff was friendly and helpful, and our rooms were ready for us when we arrived from our trans-Atlantic flight at 10:30 am.
reviews.title: Stylish hotel in the heart of the action

likes.liked: — The central location, stylish design and helpful staff
likes.disliked: — Nothing although noise from the road could be an issue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: Other visitors had noted that the location was noisy, but neither of the rooms we had [numbers 301 and 511] gave us any problems. The elevators are a bit funky, with lights that dim to a blue glow when the doors close. Room lighting could be improved a bit, but that's about our only complaint.
reviews.title: Great location, but maybe too trendy for its own good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had a business trip on Tuesday and decided to fly early to Madrid to have extra time in the city. I booked a room at De Las Letras based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. I arrived at the hotel at 10am and was surprised that I was shown to my room right way (which had been upgraded from a room with two twin beds to a room with a king size). The room and bathroom were both good sizes, the bed was marvoulous and I had to struggle to get myself out of bed, it was very quite in the hotel and my room. The only complaint I had was that the shower water would get very hot and then back to warm so I had to step away from the stream every 30 seconds are so. The receptionists were great and provided me with great directions and recommendations. The location of the hotel was also great, it was on a major street, and I was a bit worried as I read on a tour book that Gran Via was not recommended at night, but the staff assured me that it was quite safe and there were always people around. I was within walking distance to shopping, museums, and parks and was able to find great tapas bars along the way. I walked home at night alone at 1am and 3am and never had a problem or felt unsate. I would definitely recommend this hotel and am looking forward to coming back again! As a tip - I booked this hotel by emailing the hotel directly, I think that gives one better rates than the various travel sites out there that make commissions.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband booked this hotel based on the Tripadvisor ranking (it was not in any of the guidebooks and now we know why) for the last leg of our honeymoon for three nights in June. We've always had great experiences with Tripadvisor suggestions and this was the first deviation. Overall, the atmosphere and room were poor, the service was horrible, the attitude was intolerable and the location was not for us. Barely a 3-star hotel.
reviews.title: Not Thrilled

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bad:
reviews.title: Stylish and Cool

likes.disliked: — Front desk - after the grand entrance this is a bit unpreposing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Atmosphere - Can be described as wannabe trendy - superior than thou attitude with no style. We had just come from an excellent trendy hotel in Barcelona (Hotel Omm) and this place, unlike Omm, was rude and unappealing. Adding some vibrant wall color and Ikea furniture may impress some, but it's really only a cut above the Holiday Inn. Everything was old, wrinkled and slightly dusty. Neither my husband nor I liked the "aura." Room was just ok and bathroom was small; shower poured water on the floor and there was no tub. Seemed to be populated mainly by not so attractive 40-somethings who like to feel superior. If you want trendy try the Urban, the Hotel Reina Victoria, the Puerta America or, for something in the same price range, the Roommate Alicia, all of which were in better locations. We also had a very good experience with a Hi-Tech hotel in another city booking through Tripadvisor and there were a couple of those hotels on the Gran Via.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service - Awful. Ostensibly a four-star hotel, right? Well, we called the front desk on our first day to ask how to make restaurants at Sant Celoni and Asiana, two of the nicest (and excellent btw) restaurants in town. They said they didn't know what those places were (!) and that if we had the number, we should call them ourselves. Mind you, my husband is a very polite native spanish speaker and we did not give them any reason to be rude to us. All of the members of the staff looked crotchety and reluctant to be there. Upon arrival, knowing that average dinner time in the city did not start until 8 or 9pm, we went to the restaurant at 6:30pm to see if we could get a bite anyway, it being a hotel restaurant. There were people eating in the restaurant and we asked the waitress if it was closed. She rudely replied "But of course! and began whispering to the bartender as if we were stupid for asking that question." We thanked her and walked away. A couple hours later, we went to the rooftop terrace (not very impressive) to take a look at the view. The same waitress came up to us and said, "Are you hotel guests? If not, I have to ask you to leave." We were dressed nicely and looked normal. My husband told her yes and she looked embarrased but by that time we were extremely soured on the place.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel, but the restaurant was another story...

likes.liked: — Very clean room, well designed, every facility in room good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: Have to agree with previous reviewer from Sydney and thanks to all reviewers of this hotel. Took your recommendations as had never been to Madrid before.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: I had a superior room that was good-sized and nicely appointed with one of the most comfortable king beds I ever slept in. Cost was a little steep at 190 euros but met a couple staying in one of the standard rooms and they were a little less satisfied. The location is very good and the front desk was always pleasant and helpful. Free internet was a plus and the adjoining restaurant was good. Definitely would recommend.
reviews.title: Pretty Good Hotel
A great hotel at an amazing price
reviews.text: We stayed in 8 different hotels on our vacation in Spain, France and Italy. Hotel de las Letras was hands down our favorite. Some of the other hotels were over twice the price but could not compare to the las Letras. Perfect location, highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: Great hotel in a perfect location
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: This was another stop in our fabulous 3 week honeymoon in Spain!
reviews.title: This place is AWESOME !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: We absolutely LOVED Hotel De Las Letras. The reviews here already seem to cover a lot of the great positive points of the hotel -- superior design, comfort, and incredible location.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Madrid
We love De las Letras Hotel madrid
reviews.text: We came to Madrid after staying in the Parador in Santiago de Compostela. After the fantastic and historic 500 year old Parador, we felt like we made a switch to a fantastic newly designed hotel. We were very satisfied with our stay.

reviews.title: Great central position
reviews.text: The bed was extremely comfortable, and the shower was great. We'd had some problems with short hot water supplies and cold showers in other places in Spain, but this was not the case with De Las Letras - nice hot, satisfying showers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: We had the top floor suite with a private terrace jacuzzi, sooo nice. We had "The Road Not Traveled" above our bed. We ate in the restaurant one night, which was delicious and well priced.
reviews.title: Trendy and Generally Comfortable in Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights in Standard room. It had 2 seater sofa for resting "Prado weary" feet. As others say the rooms have dim lights and dark walls but the bathroom was fine. Strangely the lift is very dark with only violet lights! The corridors are very light and airy, much better than most hotels, so i guess it is all down to personal taste.
reviews.title: We liked it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar area is very good for coffee and snacks as well as drinks and seems very popular with locals. Try the tart Tatin with ice cream. As ever though it is VERY dark. No chance of reading the books that are used as decor. We went down to the nice library when we wanted to get some peace and quiet.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is a strange mix of Japan meets Heston Blumenthal, since a main course can be had for about £10(12 euro) and wine is 2.50E a glass it is great value and well worth a try.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but don't think it deserves #1 ranking.

likes.liked: — decor of room and hot tub

reviews.title: Nice hotel, but overhyped
reviews.text: Back to the room, the bathroom has two sinks but no bidet, the fittings are works of art but the overbath shower though powerful does not have a thermostat so watch the hot water tap. An odd omission when so much has been spent on the fittings. Electric towel rail.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Good linen and fluffy towels were changed daily.
reviews.title: Nice yet a little overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's one of those design or boutique hotels, call it as you like it, but it's a rare case where style does not come before substance. First of all, it does not cost you an arm and a leg. Actually, I was able to book it for a very, very good price over their chain's website. I wouldn't have been able to get a hotel room near Heathrow for the price I paid here. Service is excellent but not posh or posey. The room I got was enormous and the bathroom was also excellent. The hotel restaurant was very good also with very good prices. Worth mentioning that the hotel is just steps to the Metro and don't forget that in Madrid you can get from the airport to the city by metro for one euro! Also close to everything you probably want to do in Madrid, especially the nightlife.
reviews.title: Substance over Style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Bedrooms and public areas are modern and stylish, even if style does occasionally overtake practicality a little in the bedrooms. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast is good but the other restaurant food, which has a heavy oriental influence, is less impressive. The popular bar does a useful range of snacks, however. The location is very convenient for the Metro all the city centre attractions and the "Madrid Vision" tour buses stop right across the road. By UK standards, well worth the price.
reviews.title: A good hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent three nights at Hotel de las Letras. Superb superior room (507)
reviews.title: Superb....Shame About The Traffic Noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and bathroom. Spacious and comfortable. Huge windows with great view of building opposite with fabulous terrace and tower.
reviews.title: Falls short of the mark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only one complaint is the lack of sound-proofing. The windows need (thicker?) double-glazing. The noise from the traffic was far from muffled! And the room was not over-looking the Gran Vía. With a hotel
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed five nights. A super hotel. Staff are very friendly and and knowledegable. The bar is a nice area (but beware the smokers!).
reviews.title: Great Location and great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The restaurant has some interesting dishes well presented. The room service menu is good and reasonably priced and prompt.
reviews.title: W Style Hotel for Fraction of the Price & Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only real thing missing is a pool, but there again you go to Madrid to see to sights.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay
Cool and comfy
reviews.text: I booked a 2 night stay at this property. It was highly rated on this

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: site and now I know why. It's on Gran Via which is a great location.
reviews.title: The Best, The Best, The Best, The Best

likes.liked: — The Size of the rooms, the comfort, the high end facilities, the staff,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: After coming from a very small but quaint hotel room in Sevilla, it was such a relief to come to De las Letras and enjoy a superior (triple) room with lots of space and creature comforts such as bathrobes, slippers, heated towel rack and a separate bath tub and shower. it is a very modern hotel recently built, the location is central and the service is good.
reviews.title: Modern city hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a trip that included Paris and Rome, and this was by far the best hotel. Spacious rooms with an art-deco theme that takes a little getting used to. Poetry on the walls, and a particularly appropriate poem about stairs near the elevator. The staff was very helpful. There weren't enough attendants at the buffet breakfast to maintain the food trays and pour coffee/tea. Even though this was on the Gran Via once we closed the doors to the balcony of our 2d floor room outside noise was imperceptible. We used train/metro from the airport and only had a one block walk. All in all, this is a superb hotel in a central location.
reviews.title: Great hotel, nice location, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found the hotel staff to be extremely helpful, recommending good restaurants close by, things to do and see and were very pleasant. The rooms are very trendy and modern and plasma TVs are a nice touch. Even the upmarket toiletries provided were top class. The breakfast was well above average. Not often you get freshly squeezed orange for breakfast, and such a large variety of foods on offer. No room for lunch!
reviews.title: Brilliant!

likes.liked: — Modern rooms, excellent service, great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: Hard to believe it's not a five-star hotel. Found the location to be central and only a five minute walk to museums, galleries and shops.
reviews.title: Good hotel. OK location.
Midsummer Airconditioned Kool
reviews.text: Mucho gracias!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 day trip to Madrid. Our decision to stay in Hotel De las letras was predominantly based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and to say we were pleased with our choice is an understatement. From the moment we spotted the hotel's livery as we walked along the Grand Via it was obvious that the this was a premiere establishment. We were greeted by the friendly receptionist who was glad to humour our basic attempts at Spanish and ensured we were aware of all the hotel had to offer. We were left with the impression that nothing was too much trouble. The standard room was a good size and tastefully decorated, bathroom was excellent (liked the double sinks) and our view over the Grand Via was superb. And the soundproofing meant we enjoyed a good nights sleep while the madrilenos continued their festivites into the wee small hours.
reviews.title: Our expectations where high and Hotel de las Letras exceeded them

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't eat in the restaurant however did order room service and were not disappointed. "Burger" was practically a piece of steak and my wife tells me her risotto was exquisite. Bar was relaxed but a bit pricey but then you don't go on holiday to spend all your time in the hotel bar do you ?!
reviews.title: Sophisticated and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all we loved the hotel and would recommend it to anybody looking for a well-located boutique hotel in this fantastic city
reviews.title: Great room, great location, great restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whenever I book a stylish "hipster hotel" Iike the de las Letras I worry that when the front desk sees a middle-aged couple not wearing Versace and lugging old suitcases through the lobby our reservation will suddenly be "misplaced." Not to worry at this hotel. My husband and I arrived utterly exhausted and miserable after sprinting through Heathrow to catch our connection to Madrid. We discovered upon arrival that the above-mentioned old suitcases, being checked and therefore unable to sprint with us, were still in London. The front desk staff at the de las Letras listed patiently to my bad Spanish and responded politely in perfect English that our room was ready.
reviews.title: I loved it - Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was even better than it had looked on the hotel's website. Despite our less-than-glamorous appearance, my husband and I are interested in modern design and look forward to opportunities to see what's new and cutting-edge. In this the hotel did not disappoint. The sliding door to the bathroom was a solid piece of cobalt blue lucite. We had a flat-screen TV with a full range of satellite channels, including CNN and the BBC. The walls were a beautiful paprika color. The immaculate and surprisingly large bathroom was fully stocked with toiletries, including disposable razors. In addition to the usual "what's going on in Madrid this week" magazines, the room had a pocket "design" guide to the city showing where all the most stylish restaurants and shopping were to be found. The platform bed was comfortable, and everything was spotless. The room was small, but not unduly so considering the hotel is in an old building. The elevators were also quite small, but again no more so than is typical in Europe.
reviews.title: cool, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in April whilst attending a conference. The room was great and they immediately changed the duvet for a thin coverlet when asked. The staff were all very friendly and helpful with directions and booking restaurants. The hotel bar was generally busy with locals. The bar prices were very reasonable and the snacks were excellent.
reviews.title: very friendly staff
A little gem!
reviews.text: We had read that the metro was 500m away but it is more like 200-300. We found an excellent restaurant nearby called Sama Sama.

description: The name Hotel De las Letras pays homage to the world of literature and to pictograms as the primeval elements of written language.The building is included in the city's heritage register and dates from 1917. It was created by architect Cesáreo Iradier as the home of the Count of Artaza, and was renovated for use as a hotel in 2005 by architects Virginia Figueras and Franco Corada.It comprises 109 rooms, the De las Letras Restaurant, Lounge Bar, BOCABLO, Ático de Las Letras, the Library, the Gym and the DL's Function Rooms.It is a four star hotel, part of the anima hotels group.
